intro: Lepisanthes palawanica, commonly known as the Palawan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas of lowland forests and is often found in the province of Palawan. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered fruits that contain several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
